project.teaser: AFRIFOOD-Links AfriFOODlinks aims to improve food and nutrition security, while delivering positive outcomes for climate and the environment, and building social and ecological resilience in 65+ Cities (15 African and 5 European Implementation cities and 40+ Network Cities)...
project.objective:
AFRIFOOD-Links AfriFOODlinks aims to improve food and nutrition security, while delivering positive outcomes for climate and the environment, and building social and ecological resilience in 65+ Cities (15 African and 5 European Implementation cities and 40+ Network Cities) cities by: 1) applying an urban food systems lens to promote shifts to healthy, sustainable diets, 2) transforming urban food environments through real-world socio-technical experiments; 3) promoting inclusive multi-actor governance to empower public officials, small businesses and communities with ownership and agency to shape their food systems; and 4) accelerating innovative, women- and youth-led agri-food businesses to support local value addition and inclusive economic participation.
AfriFOODlinks invests in direct food system change in 5 African Hub Cities, and invites 10 African and 5 European Sharing Cities to join the Hub Cities on a mutual-learning journey, to share their innovative food systems and to co-design specific pilot projects for implementation in each Sharing City. Researchers, posted within each of the 20 local governments, will support the city to articulate its identified food system challenges and own authentic approach to improving access to healthy, nutritious food - with a particular attention to vulnerable groups - and reducing food related environmental impacts through food systems intervention. In this way, these implementation cities become flagships - beacons of inspiration for urban food systems transitions across the continent to inspire and share with over 40 Network cities, who are invited to adopt and adapt.
project.title: TRANSFORMING AFRICA’S URBAN FOOD ENVIRONMENTS THROUGH STRENGTHENING LINKAGES BETWEEN FOOD SYSTEMS STAKEHOLDERS IN CITIES ACROSS EUROPE AND THE CONTINENT
project.keywords: urban food systems, urban food environments, multi-actor governance, agri-food businesses, inclusive economic participation, social and ecological resilience

article.title: Better food systems intervention for Africa

result.title: Project website & central Knowledge Hub
result.description: The project website will be designed to provide an accessible overview of the project objectives and proposed activities. It will also house an interactive knowledge hub that will host all the project resources and enable other stakeholders to upload their resources, with an approval process.

result.title: Assessment of the entrepreneurial ecosystem in each hub city
result.description: This deliverable will be an assessment of the entrepreneurial ecosystem in each hub city, looking at the specific enabling policies for entrepreneurship, mapping key players that are providing incubation and acceleration support for new and young businesses, as well as identifying some potential market options

result.title: 5 Baseline reports of food environments in the Hub Cities
result.description: In alignment with D 1.1, 5 baseline reports of the form and function of food environments in each of the five hub cities will be produced, specifically to identify key gaps and opportunities for improving access to nutritious food.

result.title: Practice Abstracts – batch 1
result.description: “This deliverable contains 1 practice abstract that sets the basis for the project concept and aims”

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: This deliverable will be used by all project partners to inform how communication, dissemination and exploitation is undertaken across the project.

result.title: DMP update
result.description: The data management plan will be updated to include any changes and will explain the protocols for data collection, storage, sharing and analysis.

result.title: Toolkit of EU projects with results relevant to AU cities (M10) PU
result.description: An overview of existing EU projects that have produced outputs and results relevant to African cities will be collated into a toolkit for project partners to make use of in undertaking the AfriFOODlinks project work

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - AfriFOOD-Links (TRANSFORMING AFRICA’S URBAN FOOD ENVIRONMENTS THROUGH STRENGTHENING LINKAGES BETWEEN FOOD SYSTEMS STAKEHOLDERS IN CITIES ACROSS EUROPE AND THE CONTINENT)
result.teaser: AfriFOODlinks aims to address the systemic underpinnings of food insecurity and environmental impact, to lead to real transformation. AfriFOODlinks views urban food environments as the key arena for improving nutrition and reducing environmental impact in African cities. This...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: 15 ‘State of the City Food System’ reports- AU
result.description: This is the outcome of surface level research in five hub cities and 10 African sharing cities. It collates existing research and engages with local governments to understand the most pressing challenges that they are facing and the priorities that they have articulated. It provides a basis for the continuing governance, business incubation, and food environment experiments, collating necessary information to inform these pieces of work

result.title: City food system governance assessments (reports), including stakeholder mapping
result.description: Based on the governance assessment methodology, five governance assessment reports, including stakeholder maps, will be produced to inform the governance processes unfolding in each of the hub cities

result.title: EU-AU exchange action plan on food system (M12) PU
result.description: An action plan for EU AU exchange on urban food systems will be developed and will set the basis for purposeful engagement across and after the project

result.title: Central Knowledge Hub & Guidance note on its use/functions
result.description: This deliverable is an online interactive knowledge repository to which any stakeholders can upload relevant research, reports and documentation on urban food systems in Africa and Europe. The platform will be accompanied by a guidance note for how users can engage with the platform and how administrators must maintain it.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The data management plan will explain the protocols for data collection, storage, sharing and analysis.

result.title: City Governance Action Plans & Monitoring Frameworks
result.description: Based on the initial convenings of multi stakeholder platforms, a city governance action plan and monitoring framework will be co-developed in the five hub cities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
